title: Base Metals Market Navigates Volatility: Aluminum Shines ...
summary: Aluminum has been a standout performer in 2025, with LME aluminum forwards rising 5.06% in the first nine months and continuing to climb in October, reaching $2,857.50 USD/T on October 24. The price increase is driven by strong demand from energy transition sectors and supply constraints including China's production cap and alumina supply disruptions, pushing the market into an anticipated deficit for 2025.

title: Macro and Fundamentals Resonate Positively, Aluminum Prices Expected to Fluctuate at Highs
summary: SHFE aluminum prices showed bullish momentum with the most-traded contract closing at 21,265 yuan/mt on October 23, up 0.64%. Technical indicators suggest prices will hover at highs with resistance around 21,400–21,580 yuan/mt and support near 20,730–20,930 yuan/mt, though caution is advised for potential retreat from these highs.

title: Aluminum fell to 2,859.90 USD/T on October 24, 2025, down 0.11% from the previous day
summary: Aluminum prices slightly declined to $2,859.90 per tonne on October 24, 2025, down 0.11% from the previous day, but have risen 7.47% over the past month and 6.91% year-on-year. The market remains tight due to China's aluminum output cap and strong demand, with forecasts expecting prices around $2,805.80 by the end of the quarter and $2,929.65 in 12 months.

title: Aluminum Oct '25 (ALV25) - Futures
summary: Aluminum futures for October 2025 traded at a high of 2,776.75, showing a 9.29% increase over the past month and a 6.23% rise over three months. The 52-week performance shows a 2.48% increase compared to the previous year, indicating sustained upward momentum in aluminum prices.

title: Base Metals Market Navigates Volatility: Aluminum Shines ...
summary: Aluminum prices have surged by 5.06% in the first nine months of 2025 and continued climbing into October, reaching a three-year peak near $2,900 per ton. This rise is driven by strong demand from electric vehicles, renewable energy infrastructure, and lightweight construction, alongside supply constraints such as China's cap on aluminum production and alumina supply disruptions, pushing the global market into an anticipated deficit for 2025.

title: US aluminum scrap trade faces 2025 shake-up amid tariffs and global demand
summary: The US aluminum scrap trade experienced significant changes in early 2025 due to tariffs and shifting global demand. Imports of aluminum scrap rose 31% in the first half of 2025 compared to the previous year, despite a 25% import tariff introduced in March, which led recyclers to increasingly rely on domestic recovery.

title: Alcoa said it will invest about $60 million to modernize part of its aluminum smelter in Massena, New York
summary: Alcoa announced a $60 million investment to modernize part of its aluminum smelter in Massena, New York, following the signing of a new 10-year hydropower agreement. This modernization aims to enhance production efficiency and sustainability at the facility.

title: Can circular aluminium provide a blueprint for a post-plastic world?
summary: Ellie Gabel discusses the benefits, challenges, and future potential of circular aluminium in driving a sustainable economy and reducing reliance on plastics. Aluminium's infinite recyclability and existing recycling infrastructure make it a strong candidate for replacing plastics in a circular economy, with recycled aluminium requiring only 5% of the energy used for virgin production.

title: Recycled aluminium for sustainable shipbuilding
summary: Speira's recycled aluminium alloy offers a sustainable approach to shipbuilding, helping reduce environmental impact in the yachting industry. The marine-grade aluminium used by yacht builder Arksen features higher mechanical properties and a higher recycled content, supporting hybrid propulsion vessels with lower lifecycle resource intensity.

title: Alcoa invests $60M in US aluminium smelter & signs 10-year energy pact
summary: Alcoa Corporation announced a $60 million investment in its Massena Operations in New York, including upgrades to the anode baking furnace, alongside a 10-year renewable energy pact with New York Power Authority. This initiative aims to strengthen sustainable aluminium production in the US by combining renewable energy with advanced furnace technology.

title: The future of US aluminium hinges on energy, not tariff policy
summary: Industry leaders emphasize that affordable electricity, rather than tariffs, is the key to revitalizing US aluminium production. Aluminium smelting is highly energy-intensive, requiring long-term energy contracts at competitive rates to be financially viable, with current US industrial electricity prices posing a significant challenge compared to hydro-rich Canada.

title: Base Metals Market Navigates Volatility: Aluminum Shines Amidst Shifting Global Dynamics
summary: Aluminum prices have surged in 2025 driven by strong demand from the energy transition sectors such as electric vehicles and renewable energy infrastructure. Supply constraints, including China's production caps and alumina disruptions, have tightened the market, pushing global aluminum supply into a deficit and highlighting its critical role in sustainable technologies.

title: "METALEX 2025" Ready to Spotlight Next-Generation Machinery Driving ASEAN Metalworking Toward Smart Manufacturing
summary: METALEX 2025 conference features sessions on aluminum industry trends, smart manufacturing, and sustainability, including an International Symposium on Light Materials Technology focusing on Thailand's readiness as an aluminum innovation hub. The event highlights AI applications, robotics, and sustainable manufacturing technologies relevant to aluminum production and processing.

title: Steel price rises slightly to 3,054 CNY/T on October 24, 2025
summary: Steel prices increased by 0.46% from the previous day, reaching 3,054 CNY/T. Despite this daily rise, steel prices have fallen 0.75% over the past month and are down 5.83% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts expect steel to trade at around 3,009 Yuan/MT by the end of the quarter and 2,876 Yuan/MT in 12 months.

title: HRC Steel Hits 4-week High at 832 USD/T
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) steel prices rose to 815 USD/T on October 24, 2025, up 0.25% from the previous day, reaching a 4-week high of 832 USD/T. Over the past 12 months, HRC steel prices have increased by 13.64%, although recent weeks showed some volatility with a 12-week low recorded in late September.

title: US ferrous scrap prices expected to fall further in October 2025
summary: Ferrous scrap prices in the US are forecasted to continue declining in October, following a downward trend from September. The market sentiment is bearish due to lower demand, with all market segments expecting weak price performance. Inventories remain slightly below average, indicating supply constraints are unlikely to support prices.

title: NLMK USA raises prices for hot-rolled and cold-rolled coil by $50 per short ton
summary: NLMK USA announced an immediate price increase of at least $50 per short ton for hot-rolled and cold-rolled coil spot orders. The steel industry is also facing potential demand challenges due to possible production shutdowns in the US auto sector caused by chip shortages, which could negatively impact steel demand.

title: Usiminas reports net loss of $651 million in Q3 2025
summary: Brazilian steel producer Usiminas posted a net loss of BRL 3.503 billion ($651.1 million) in Q3 2025, reversing from a net profit in the same quarter last year. The loss was mainly due to asset impairment and deferred tax recoverability issues, though excluding these, the company reported a net profit. Steel product sales volume declined by 2%, while iron ore sales increased by 9%.

title: China's Stellar Steel to Invest $450 Million in New Steel Plant in Nigeria
summary: China's Stellar Steel is investing $450 million in a new steel plant in Nigeria's Ogun State. The facility will produce hot-rolled coil steel, iron steel doors, and gas cylinders, aiming to reduce Nigeria's reliance on imported steel products. Operations are expected to begin by mid-2026.

title: Usiminas Reports Net Loss in Q3 2025
summary: Usiminas reported a net loss of BRL 3.503 billion ($651.1 million) for Q3 2025, primarily due to asset impairments. The company's steel sales declined by 2%, while iron ore sales increased by 9%. Despite the loss, Usiminas noted stable cash flow.

title: Brazil's Steel Demand to Slow: Usiminas
summary: Usiminas expects Brazil's steel demand to slow in the fourth quarter, following seasonal trends. The company reported a decline in crude steel production and rolled steel output. Despite recent price increases, Usiminas forecasts stable steel prices for the quarter.

title: Steel Tech 2025: The Event Where Steel, Technology, and Innovation Shape Its Future
summary: Steel Tech 2025 will be held at the Bilbao Exhibition Centre from October 21 to 23, 2025. The event focuses on innovation and development in the steel sector, featuring a high-level congress and discussions on carbon neutrality and AI. It brings together industry leaders to exchange knowledge and generate business opportunities.

title: Sassda Spearheads Stainless Steel Master Plan As Sector Roadmap to 2030
summary: The Southern Africa Stainless Steel Development Association (Sassda) has launched a new Stainless Steel Master Plan to guide the sector's growth and sustainability to 2030. The plan involves a wide range of stakeholders to align industrial growth with sustainability and social objectives. It aims to realize stainless steel's potential as a high-value contributor to South Africa's economy.

title: Signals of Change – October 2025
summary: Microsoft has signed a seven-year deal for green hydrogen-based steel from Swedish firm Stegra, highlighting the momentum of the clean energy transition. This move is part of a broader effort to decarbonize industrial materials, with technology giants pioneering new procurement strategies for clean materials.

title: Copper Hovers Near $11000 as Market Tightness Intensifies
summary: Copper futures reached $10,962.50 per metric ton in recent London trading, marking a 25% gain year-to-date amid supply-demand imbalances rather than speculative trading. Strong Chinese manufacturing and renewable energy investments underpin sustained copper demand, while geopolitical trade policies continue to influence market sentiment.

title: Copper price tumbles as Trump threatens massive new tariffs on China
summary: Copper prices dropped nearly 5% to below $10,400 per ton on the London Metal Exchange after President Trump threatened a significant increase in tariffs on Chinese goods. This caused market turmoil, reversing recent rallies driven by supply setbacks in major copper mines and raising concerns about trade tensions impacting the metal's demand.

title: Copper Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Copper prices were volatile in Q3 2025, reaching record highs on COMEX due to tariff announcements by the Trump administration. The unexpected 50% tariff on copper imports triggered a short squeeze and price disparities between COMEX and LME, with prices continuing to strengthen into October.

title: The Outlook For Aluminum, Steel & Copper Prices
summary: J.P. Morgan forecasts copper prices averaging $8,300/mt in Q2 2025 amid reduced demand expectations. While Chinese demand and firm fundamentals support prices above $9,000/mt temporarily, global demand slowdown and trade policy uncertainties, including tariffs, pose risks to sustained price strength.

title: Copper's $2T Investment Gap: Best Stocks for 2025
summary: Global copper demand is projected to surge 70% by 2050, but supply faces structural constraints including declining ore grades and long development timelines. Copper hit an all-time high of $5.65/lb in July 2025 amid tariff threats and supply concerns, with forecasts suggesting potential prices up to $12,000/tonne driven by structural deficits and demand from AI and renewable energy sectors.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper prices rose to $5.09 per pound on October 24, 2025, up 0.29% from the previous day and showing a 7.74% increase over the past month. The metal is up 17.33% compared to the same time last year, with expectations to trade around $5.08 per pound by the end of the quarter and $5.59 in 12 months.

title: [Copper Inventory] On October 25th, LME copper inventory decreased by 1,550 tonnes to 276,775 tonnes
summary: The London Metal Exchange reported a decrease in copper inventory by 1,550 tonnes on October 25, 2025, lowering total stocks to 276,775 tonnes, indicating tightening supply conditions in the market.

title: Copper price rises on mine struggles, Goldman bull flag
summary: Copper prices climbed nearly 2% as major miners issued conservative production outlooks, exacerbating supply concerns amid global mine disruptions. Chile’s Antofagasta expects to hit the low end of its 2025 production target and provided a 2026 forecast below analyst expectations, signaling ongoing tightness in the market.

title: Copper price hovers near $11,000 as test of record high beckons
summary: Copper prices remain just below $11,000 per ton, close to record highs, as supply concerns persist following operational issues at major mines like Grasberg in Indonesia. Freeport-McMoRan confirmed the Grasberg mine remains halted, with an update on the outlook expected next month.

title: Copper Hovers Near $11000 as Market Tightness Intensifies
summary: Copper futures are trading near $10,962.50 per ton, up about 25% year-to-date, as supply-demand imbalances drive prices toward record levels. Strong Chinese industrial demand, especially in renewable energy and electric vehicles, continues to support the market amid global supply disruptions.

title: Trump Reverses Biden Copper Smelter Rules in 2025
summary: President Trump has reversed Biden-era emission standards for copper smelters, granting a two-year exemption to the two remaining U.S. facilities. The move aims to bolster domestic mineral security by reducing regulatory burdens on the already limited U.S. copper smelting industry.

title: Trump reverses Biden-era copper smelter pollution limits to boost mineral security
summary: The Trump administration has rolled back stricter emission limits on copper smelters, providing a two-year compliance exemption to support domestic production. The policy targets the two operational U.S. smelters, citing concerns over industrial base erosion and reliance on foreign processing.

title: Trump reverses Biden-era rules on copper smelters
summary: President Trump has revoked Biden-era pollution rules for copper smelters, offering a two-year exemption to the two remaining U.S. facilities. The administration framed the move as essential for maintaining mineral independence and reducing reliance on foreign copper processing.

title: Copper In Its Natural State: 2026 Mining Breakthroughs
summary: New copper mining technologies in 2026 focus on sustainability, automation, and efficiency. Innovations include AI-driven automated drilling, sensor-based ore sorting to reduce energy use, bioleaching with bacteria to lower emissions, digital twin modeling for resource optimization, and blockchain for traceability, all aimed at enhancing copper extraction while minimizing environmental impact.

title: BHP's Copper Boom: Sustainable Mining to Meet Soaring Global Demand
summary: BHP reported record copper production with a focus on sustainable mining practices to support the energy transition and urban development. The company’s Escondida mine in Chile achieved a 17-year production high, driven by improved recoveries and new projects, aligning with BHP’s long-term growth and clean energy goals.

title: Copper Products Market worth $645.86 billion by 2035 at 5.6%
summary: The copper products market is projected to grow significantly due to demand from construction, power, electronics, and industrial manufacturing sectors. Copper’s recyclability and durability make it a preferred material for sustainable urbanization, smart city development, and energy-efficient systems, reinforcing its role in green infrastructure.

title: Copper's Golden Decade: Global Market Set to Soar Beyond $450 Billion by 2034, Fueling Green Transition and Industrial Evolution
summary: Copper demand is driven by the green energy transition, electrification, and electric vehicles, which require significantly more copper than traditional technologies. The metal’s critical role in renewable energy infrastructure, construction, and industrial machinery supports a forecasted market growth to over $450 billion by 2034 despite supply challenges.

title: LME nickel prices rise on Oct 25 due to bullish news
summary: LME nickel futures increased by US$43 on October 25, closing at US$18,317 per ton, while the spot price also rose by US$43 to US$18,085 per ton, reflecting bullish market sentiment.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices fell slightly to 15,325 USD/T on October 24, down 0.07% from the previous day. Despite a 0.56% rise over the past month, prices remain 5.07% lower than a year ago, with forecasts suggesting a decline to around 14,206 USD/MT in the next 12 months due to oversupply concerns.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Drop Slightly on October 22 as Substantial Progress Emerges in Russia-Ukraine Conflict
summary: Nickel prices dropped slightly on October 22, influenced by geopolitical developments including progress toward ceasefire negotiations in the Russia-Ukraine conflict and expectations of US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, which affect market sentiment.

title: Nickel Prices: Stainless Mills Hold Prices Pre-Contracting
summary: Nickel prices have remained range-bound through September and October with some upward drift, but downside risks persist due to funds shifting to net short positions and ample supply. The market faces headwinds from global economic conditions and a strong US dollar, limiting price strength.

title: PP Presisi secures Rp150 billion contract for Antam nickel project
summary: PT PP Presisi Tbk has secured a contract worth Rp150 billion for an Antam nickel project, strengthening its presence in Indonesia's mining sector. The deal highlights the ongoing development of nickel projects in the region. Further details about the project's scope and timeline are not provided.

title: FPX Nickel Provides Update on Fall 2025 Community Open House Events
summary: FPX Nickel is hosting community open house events to update stakeholders on its Baptiste Nickel Project. The project is a significant greenfield discovery with potential for low-carbon nickel production. The events aim to engage local communities and provide updates on project developments.

title: Cobalt And Nickel Mining Companies: 2026 Sustainable Trends
summary: By 2026, over 60% of cobalt and nickel mining companies will adopt sustainable extraction methods for battery supply chains. Innovations include AI-driven environmental monitoring, blockchain traceability, and recycling to reduce dependence on virgin mining. These technologies support environmental management and supply security in the growing battery metals market.

title: Canada Nickel and NetCarb Advance Strategic Partnership to Unlock Zero-Carbon Industrial Cluster in Northeastern Ontario
summary: Canada Nickel and NetCarb are progressing in developing a proprietary carbon sequestration process that could sequester up to ten times more CO2 than current methods while producing valuable by-products like hydrogen and magnesium. This technology aims to position the Timmins Nickel District as a decarbonization hub and create new economic opportunities through sustainable nickel mining.

title: Re-energising the nickel industry through sustainable battery production
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals is developing the TECH Project, a carbon-negative facility in Australia that will produce high-grade, ethically sourced nickel for batteries using the patented DNi Process™. This environmentally friendly process recycles 98% of nitric acid, requires no tailings dam, and minimizes waste, supporting sustainable nickel laterite ore processing for the EV and energy storage sectors.

title: Mining Tech Revolution: Driving Faster Adoption in 2025
summary: The mining sector is accelerating technology adoption to meet surging demand for critical minerals like nickel, driven by renewable energy growth and EV market expansion. Challenges include declining ore grades and rising operational costs, making advanced mining technologies essential to sustain supply and support the global energy transition.

title: Engineering the future: how Tubacex innovation is advancing connection technologies for critical energy applications through the DESSERT project
summary: Tubacex is innovating in premium connection technologies and hydrogen energy through the DESSERT project, supporting safer hydrogen storage and utilization as a sustainable energy resource. This initiative highlights the company's commitment to advancing sustainable energy solutions and the energy transition.

title: CVA to construct four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily benefiting Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali will benefit from enhanced energy performance and reduced environmental impact through a Memorandum of Understanding with CVA, which will build four photovoltaic plants in Sicily with over 20 MW capacity. This partnership supports the company's decarbonisation goals and economic competitiveness within the 2026–2029 Strategic Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started the pilot phase of its green hydrogen production project at its Aosta plant, using a 1.008 MW electrolyzer to produce 165 tons of hydrogen annually. Supported by €7.9 million from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan, the project aims to reduce carbon emissions and power one of the plant's furnaces entirely with green hydrogen.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has commenced operations at a pilot green hydrogen plant in Aosta, northern Italy, marking a significant step in its sustainability and decarbonisation efforts within the steel production sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion on nuclear energy and its role in Italy's boilermaking industry. The event highlighted the strategic importance of nuclear energy in Europe's energy transition and Italy's potential to strengthen its manufacturing base in the sector. Tenaris's mill in Italy recently obtained accreditation to supply materials for nuclear facilities.

title: Axpo Italia to supply green energy to Tenaris' Dalmine seamless steel pipe mill
summary: Axpo Italia has signed a Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) to supply 15 GWh of green energy to Tenaris' Dalmine seamless steel pipe mill in Italy. This agreement supports Tenaris's efforts to reduce its carbon footprint.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of the submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia as part of the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and involves laying a power cable between Sicily and Tunisia at depths up to 800 meters, enhancing energy security between Europe and Africa.

title: Prysmian Named As Preferred Bidder For Major UK High Voltage Energy Interconnection Project
summary: Prysmian has been named the preferred bidder for a significant UK high voltage energy interconnection project, demonstrating its leadership in submarine cable solutions. This follows recent awards including the Italy-Tunisia interconnection, highlighting Prysmian's expanding role in major European energy infrastructure.
